basics.name: Conner Stevons
basics.label: Data Scientist and Physicist
basics.summary: A German-born theoretical physicist, widely ranked among the greatest and most influential scientists of all time

work.name: General Dynamics Mission Systems
work.summary: Quantum Engineering Center; AI/ML Restricted Space Program; Space Payloads Project
highlights: Secured 1 patent submission and 3 Engineering Excellence awards
Worked in a diverse set of projects spanning satellite communications data analysis, Rydberg atom sensor technology, and RF test and integration of satellite payloads
Written and maintained repositories of 100+ Python and MATLAB scripts for data processing, machine learning, and data visualization tasks
Built Python models for binary/multilabel classification tasks with their accompanying performance metrics, and created insightful visuals for presentations
Experienced technical speaker in dozens of customer and internal meetings
Designed and performed lab experiments related to free-space and fiber optics as well as operating RF analyzers/signal generators

work.name: NASA Glenn Research Center (GRC)
work.summary: Interned with the NASA's Quantum Communications Group for 2 summers during the pandemic
highlights: Built multiple MATLAB models to simulate the statistical efficiency of electro‑optical devices for entangled photon generation, as well as to use these models to simulate the generation of optical frequency combs
Published whitepapers and presented research results at the NASA Quantum Information Science Conference and to NASA leadership
Collaborated with teams of NASA researchers, interns, and even astronauts across multiple centers

work.name: University of Alabama in Huntsville, Dept. of Physics
work.summary: Interned with the NASA's Quantum Communications Group for 2 summers during the pandemic
highlights: Taught 10 physics lab courses, mentoring and collaborating with hundreds of students, and enhancing their understanding and application of physics concepts and analysis
Applied research and academic knowledge to successfully capture funding to perform a quantum optics research project

Prepared experiments using optical lab skills such as free‑space alignment; manipulating optical polarization; beam focusing; generating diffraction patterns with gratings and spatial light modulators, and building various interferometers
Led scientific outreach events at 2 North Alabama Regional Science Olympiads
Passed the UAH Physics Comprehension Examination at the Ph.D. level

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine
